The Taylor series


The Taylor series is a generalisation of the Maclaurin series being a power series developed in powers of \((x-x_0)\) rather than in powers of \(x\).

Key Point

If the function \(f(x)\) can be differentiated as often as required at \(x=x_0\) then: \[f(x)=f(x_0)+(x-x_0)f'(x_0)+\dfrac{(x-x_0)^2}{2!}f''(x_0)+\cdots\] This is called the Taylor series of \(f(x)\) about the point \(x_0\).

The Maclaurin expansion is the Taylor expansion obtained if \(x_0\) is chosen to be zero.
